channel.title: My 3D game project (outcastMZ)
channel.description:
ive been working on this for a few weeks now its based on a highely modified maze3D sample
The login server is just about complete apart from a few bugs i will be making another server for the main handling of the information between the server and the client because the login server only supports one connection at a time
[11th July] added a simple region handler so that in later development it can be expanded also fixed a few bugs in the login system and added a interface screen (in a differnt window)
[SCREENSHOTS] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img64.imageshack.us/img64/9775/outcastmz4wh0.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img74.imageshack.us/img74/2144/outcastmz5ms3.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img74.imageshack.us/img74/6303/outcastmz6yk7.jpg[/img][/URL]
If you want to help with this then send me a pm with what you want to help with

item.title: My 3D game project (outcastMZ)
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:28, topic:121723”]pizza pie, if you know that in his canvas, he is using X, Y and Z coordinates to draw his images. Pretend he was making a sprite game and needed to only use X and Y, then he could do something like

Graphics.drawImage(theImage, myX, myY, null);

The X is a horrizontal lines going across the canvas whilst the Y is a vertical lines going from the top of the canvas to the bottom. The Z coordinate is for depth. That way he can use the same image he used for his sprite for four walls which would make a building.[/quote]
yea i figured out how this works when i started making my own stuff

Read full topic

[quote]i cant read the current map coords properly
and i keep geting cant be refered from static even tho there is no static in it[/quote]

Instantly confirmed you leeched this from somewhere (and have nfi what you’re doing).
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: My 3D game project (outcastMZ)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

pizza pie, if you know that in his canvas, he is using X, Y and Z coordinates to draw his images. Pretend he was making a sprite game and needed to only use X and Y, then he could do something like

Graphics.drawImage(theImage, myX, myY, null);

The X is a horrizontal lines going across the canvas whilst the Y is a vertical lines going from the top of the canvas to the bottom. The Z coordinate is for depth. That way he can use the same image he used for his sprite for four walls which would make a building.

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_outcasted_user wrote:

Iamadam:

The JPEG’s are just used as ‘textures.’ I am assuming they are ‘folded’ onto 3-dimensional shapes rendered by the game engine.

private final static String B_TEX = "images/plate.jpg";
blockApp = makeApp(blue, B_TEX, "no");
    Texture2D texture = (Texture2D) loader.getTexture();
    app.setTexture(texture);

item.title: My 3D game project (outcastMZ)
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

basically it uses mainly box and calender objects and the primitive textures loaded from files mapped to a z axis with vector3d

plz tell me if i put ur words into correct spelling… because i do not know if they are supposed to be spelled they way they are… or if you made a mistake, so yea…

the outcasted user:

there just jpgs ;p

that is impossible… this of the millions and millions of jpgs you would have to have just to have 1 object -.-, i think there is a way to program it… and im pretty sure i know what it is…

i think it is just sending the direction the person is loooking it, the handler then calculates, what parts should show… the size of those pixels, and finally, the order the objects are in (this one behind that, this one in between, etc) …

lol that is what i think… i dont think people take the time to draw millions of jpgs…

Read full topic
